chapter.title: Welcome to this LINCS Course
chapter.content:
Welcome to the Learning Disabilities and Accommodations course, a research-based training on serving adults with learning disabilities (LD). This program is brought to you by Literacy Information and Communication System (LINCS).

chapter.title: Join the LINCS Community and participate in discussions
chapter.content:
This course is designed for teachers of adult learners with LD. As with all LINCS courses, this course includes opportunities to connect with other adult education practitioners interested in providing appropriate accommodations for adult learners with learning disabilities (LD). If you haven’t already done so, take a moment to register as a member of the LINCS Community and participate in the discussions embedded throughout this course. The discussions provide an open forum to share your thoughts, ideas, and questions with other adult education practitioners.

Throughout this course, you will have the opportunity to share your stories and insights as you learn about the various accommodations appropriate for adult learners with LD. This is a great opportunity to share and learn from others. We encourage you to participate!

chapter.title: Overview and objectives
chapter.content:
In this course, we will describe and explore accommodations that instructors of adult learners with learning disabilities may provide their students to ensure equal access to educational services and resources. Let's start by reviewing the learning goals of this lesson.

Upon completion of this course, you will be able to:

  • define accommodations;
  • identify different types of accommodations;
  • describe how to access accommodations, and:
  • understand the importance of Universal Design.

Please allow approximately 1 hour to complete this course. However, you are free to leave the session at any time. When you exit the courseware, a bookmark is automatically placed at your last location to allow you to pick up where you left off when you return.

Navigation

The course is divided up into several sections: understanding accommodations; accessing accommodations through self-determination, self-disclosure, and self-advocacy; and universal design. Navigate through the course by using the forward arrows available on each page.

chapter.title: Scenario-based instruction
chapter.content:
Throughout this course, you will be presented with scenarios of individuals who may need accommodations to perform better in a given learning environment. These scenarios are designed to help you understand how accommodations work in real life situations.

After you read each scenario, review the questions that follow and select the best response. But before we explore the scenarios, we will first define and describe the term accommodations.
